official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of
		  1965 to establish a grant program to fund additional school social workers and
		  retain school social workers already employed in high-need local educational
		  agencies.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
School Social Workers Improving
			 Student Success Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subpart 2 of
			 part D of title V of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:V/pt:D/spt:2
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5421

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may award grants to high-need local
				educational agencies to enable such agencies to retain school social workers
				employed by such agencies or to hire additional school social workers.

text.#text: The

A
				grant awarded under this section shall be awarded for a period not to exceed 4
				years.

Funds made available under this section shall be used to
				supplement, and not supplant, other Federal, State, or local funds used for
				hiring and retaining school social workers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5422/ss:d/p:2

text.#text:
A local educational agency receiving a
				grant under this section shall use the grant to retain school social workers
				employed by such agencies or to hire additional school social workers providing
				services described in

A local educational agency receiving a
				grant under this section may use such grant for any of the following
				purposes:

To reimburse
				school social workers for travel expenses incurred during home visits and other
				school-related trips.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5422/ss:d/p:2

text.#text:
To reimburse
				school social workers for any additional expenses incurred in rendering the
				services described in

an application at such time, in such manner, and
				accompanied by such information as the

text.#text:
To be eligible to
				receive a grant under this section, a high-need local educational agency shall
				submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5422/ss:d

text.#text:
Each application submitted for a grant
				under this section shall contain a description of the duties and
				responsibilities of school social workers providing services to students
				through such grant in accordance with

Any school social worker
				providing services to students through a grant funded under this section
				shall—

header.#text:
Duties and
				responsibilities of school social worker

text.#text:
identify the
				highest-need students (as such term is defined by the Secretary) in each school
				such social worker serves and target services provided at the school to such
				students; and

provide to
				students in each school in which a school social worker serves, social work
				services, including—

counseling and
				crisis intervention;

providing
				assistance to teachers to design behavioral interventions;

working with
				students, families, schools, and communities to promote attendance and address
				the causes of poor attendance, such as homelessness, lack of transportation,
				illness, phobia, or parents who have negative impressions of school;

connecting
				students and families to the social welfare, child welfare, and community
				resource systems; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines are necessary to carry out this section.

text.#text: other services the

Grants awarded under this section may be renewed for
				additional periods having the same duration as the original grant
				period.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, for each renewal, a report on the
				progress of such recipient in retaining and hiring school social workers. Such
				report shall include—
